title: Workshop Facilitation Knowledge
description: Facilitation techniques, prompts, and patterns for running team workshops grounded in Axiom 0

axiom_zero_integration.philosophy: Facilitation is an act of love - creating space for others to discover their truth
core_principles: Assume positive intent in every participant
Create psychological safety through modeling vulnerability
Trust the group's wisdom to emerge
Serve the team's goals, not your agenda

axiom_zero_grounding.script: Before we begin, let's ground ourselves in our foundation: Axiom 0. All being and doing is grounded in love and trust. In this space, we assume positive intent. We create from care, not fear. We trust each other to contribute our best.
axiom_zero_grounding.follow_up: Let's go around the room. Share one hope you have for this session.

psychological_safety_setting.script: In this workshop, all ideas are welcome. Disagreement is healthy - it means we're thinking deeply. Disrespect is not. If you feel unheard, raise your hand with this gesture [demonstrate]. I'll pause to make sure everyone is included.
psychological_safety_setting.visual_cue: Hand raised with palm facing forward

energy_check.script: Quick energy check. On a scale of 1-5, show me with your fingers: how much energy do you have right now?

response.low_energy: I see some lower energy. Let's start with something active to wake us up.
response.high_energy: Great energy! Let's channel that into our first activity.

round_robin.name: Round Robin
round_robin.description: Each person speaks in turn, no interruptions
round_robin.when_to_use: When all voices need equal airtime, for sensitive topics
how_to: Explain the format: each person gets [X] minutes
Start with yourself or a volunteer
Thank each person after they speak
variations: Popcorn: after speaking, choose the next person
Reverse: go counter-clockwise to change energy

think_pair_share.name: Think-Pair-Share
think_pair_share.description: Individual thinking, partner discussion, group sharing
think_pair_share.when_to_use: Complex topics, introverted groups, when you need refined ideas
how_to: Pairs share key insights with group

fishbowl.name: Fishbowl
fishbowl.description: Inner circle discusses, outer circle observes, then swap
fishbowl.when_to_use: Large groups, complex debates, when you want focused discussion
variations: Open chair: empty seat in inner circle for outsiders to join
Tag-in: outer circle can tap someone to swap

gallery_walk.name: Gallery Walk
gallery_walk.description: Display work around room, participants walk and observe
gallery_walk.when_to_use: After creative activities, when reviewing multiple artifacts
how_to: Post all artifacts on walls or virtual board
Optional: place sticky dots on favorites

silent_brainstorm.name: Silent Brainstorm
silent_brainstorm.description: Individual idea generation before group discussion
silent_brainstorm.when_to_use: To prevent groupthink, include introverts, generate volume

dot_voting.name: Dot Voting
dot_voting.description: Distribute limited votes to prioritize options
how_to: Can place multiple dots on one item

energy_boosters.name: Quick Share
energy_boosters.script: Turn to your neighbor and share one thing you're excited about so far

energy_boosters.name: Walk and Talk
energy_boosters.script: Take a walk in pairs. Discuss [topic]. Return with one insight.

energy_boosters.name: Gratitude Burst
energy_boosters.script: Turn to someone and thank them for one contribution they've made today

energy_drains_and_fixes.conflict_tension: Pause, return to Axiom 0, acknowledge emotions
energy_drains_and_fixes.technical_difficulties: Use the break for connection while fixing
energy_drains_and_fixes.dominant_voices: Switch to round-robin or silent brainstorm

step_1_acknowledge.script: I'm hearing different perspectives here. That's actually valuable - it means we're thinking deeply about this.

step_2_clarify.script: Let me make sure I understand both positions. [Name], you're saying [X]. [Name], you're saying [Y]. Is that accurate?

step_3_explore_values.script: What value is each position protecting? What matters most to each of you here?

step_4_find_common_ground.script: What do you both agree on? Let's start there.

options: Is there a position that honors both concerns?
Can we try one approach and revisit?
Let's vote and commit to the result together
This needs more time - let's parking-lot it and return

axiom_zero_reset.script: Let's take a breath and return to our foundation. We're all here because we love this project and trust each other. From that place - how do we move forward?

time_boxing_principles: Be firm but kind about time limits
It's okay to end early if energy is high
Better to cut activities than rush through
when_running_over: Acknowledge: 'We're running long because this is important'
If deferring: 'Let's capture this and return next session'

real_time_synthesis.description: Capture and reflect key points as discussion happens
techniques: Theme identification: 'I'm noticing a pattern around...'
Bridge building: 'That connects to what [Name] said about...'
Affinity mapping: group similar ideas together
Mind mapping: show relationships between concepts
Matrix: plot ideas on two dimensions

narrative_synthesis.description: Weave ideas into a coherent story
narrative_synthesis.template: We started by exploring [X]. The key insight was [Y]. This led us to realize [Z]. Going forward, we will [A].

prompts: What's one thing that will stay with you?
What question are you still holding?

gratitude_expression.script: Before we close, I invite you to thank one person for something they contributed today.

next_steps_preview.template: In our next session, we'll explore [topic]. To prepare, please [action]. Come ready to [activity].

axiom_zero_close.script: Thank you for bringing your whole selves today. The love and trust in this room created something special. Carry that into everything you do. See you next time.

virtual_facilitation_tips: Camera on when possible - builds connection
Use chat actively - gives introverts a voice
Breakout rooms for small group work
Check in more frequently - harder to read energy
Shorter sessions - screen fatigue is real

approach: Direct invitation: 'I'd love to hear your thoughts, [Name]'
Written input: 'Let's take a minute to write thoughts before sharing'
Pair first: 'Discuss with a partner, then we'll share'
Time limits: 'Let's hear from others who haven't spoken'
Private note: 'You have great ideas - help me draw others out'
Acknowledge value: 'That's important. Let's parking-lot it.'
Redirect: 'Let's return to our main question...'
Time check: 'We have 10 minutes left for this topic'
Offer support: 'Would you like to share more?'
Protect: 'Thank you for being vulnerable. That takes courage.'
